column4: Is it possible to create a report detailing the properties of graphic images in a directory, beyond the ordinary filename, size etc. to include the size of the file in pixels?
see if gimp has any plugins
I'll check both, thanks! I have to modify a website that was created by splitting images :(
also your probbally using nautilus, other 'explorer like' programs may give different details
Yes, if I right click a file, select properties, then choose the image tab, it gives the info I want. My issue is that I have to weed through 250 some images!
You shoud have taken your mothers advice and beame president, web development isnt too glorious.
I guess I'm old school...I've not run across a web page built this way before until today! Seems like a "cheater" way to do things. Makes maintenance a b----.
sounds like it stemmed from a photoshop PSD
my company hired a XHTML guy that dose all our design work, I hope to never see one of those things again
if im not mistaken, gimp now supports PSD
(last post on this, ot) All I have to work with is what I could get with wget!
